Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. -- 2 Mills Renewal - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of two (2) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $1,990,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, to provide funding for parish senior citizens' programs and services administered by the Lafourche Council on Aging, Inc./Area Agency on Aging, including administrative costs incurred in connection therewith?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amendment Prop. No. 1 -- Art. III, Sec. G, Pres. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 1
Race.FullText: Shall Article III, Section G of the Lafourche Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows? The President and each other Council member shall be elected for a term of four (4) years. The President shall not be eligible as a candidate for re-election for the term immediately following the second term in which that person was elected as President, beginning with the 2020-2023 term. The terms shall begin at 12:01 a.m. of January first in the year following the election.

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Amendment Prop. No. 2 -- Art. III, Sec. G, Cncl. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 2
Race.FullText: Shall Article III, Section G of the Lafourche Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to add the additional paragraph? The President and each other Council member shall be elected for a term of four (4) years. Each other Council member shall not be eligible as a candidate for re-election for the term immediately following the third consecutive term in which that person was elected as a member of the Council, beginning with the members of the Council elected for the 2020-2023 term. The terms shall begin at 12:01 a.m. of January first in the year following the election.

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Golden Meadow Prop. No. 1 -- Millage Renewal 5.09 Mills - M&TC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Golden Meadow Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a special tax of five and nine hundredths (5.09) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Town (an estimated $52,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of maintaining levees in the Town of Golden Meadow?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Golden Meadow Prop. No. 2 -- Millage Renewal 5.09 Mills - M&TC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Golden Meadow Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a special tax of five and nine hundredths (5.09) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Town (an estimated $52,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of maintaining drainage works in the Town of Golden Meadow?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 4 -- Tax Renewal 6.02 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 4 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a tax of six and two hundredths (6.02) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $86,700 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in the District, including the purchase of fire trucks?
